transcripts.text: Hi, Peter Ronan, New York Fashion Times, and I have...
David Nino Rodriguez, heavyweight contender.
Hi, how are you?
Doing great.  Great.
So what are we wearing tonight?
I'm wearing Armani.
And this is not what you wear every day, is it?
No, it's usually gym clothes.
Gym clothes.  Okay.  Looks a little different.  You got dressed up tonight.
Oh, yeah.  I mean, there's playmates here.  You have to.
You got to do something, right?
Of course.
So tell me a little bit about yourself.  What are you known for?
I'm known for a devastating left hook to the head and to the body.  I got 34 knockouts, 24 of them in the first round.  And I went a little bit past Mike Tyson's first round knockout record.
Nice.  By two fights.  So we have this Pacquiao fight coming up.  What is your take on that?

I believe that, you know, considering Mayweather, I think he runs boxing.  I mean, he owns the judges.  He's going to have everything his way.  And he sends major obstacles towards Pacquiao.  I believe that, you know, my heart is with Pacquiao.  I believe that Pacquiao's going to give him a hell of a fight, but I think Mayweather's going to get the decision like he always does.  I think once he starts tasting Pacquiao's punches, he's going to get on his bike.  And just stay away from him the whole fight.  If he decides to fight with Pac-Man, I think that's going to be a big mistake.  Pac-Man may pull out the upset if he decides to engage.
So it's kind of a toss-up, actually.

You know, I was just with Pacquiao and he told me that, his exact words told me that he is looking to defeat Mayweather and the timing couldn't be better because this is what he said.  He said, I've been sent by God on a mission to destroy Mayweather, who he believes is a bad person.  So I was like, if you believe you're sent by God to go do something.
That's pretty big, right?
That's big.  You know, if you have that mindset, that's huge.
Well, there you go.  So what are you looking forward to in the next several months?

Right now I'm taking a little hiatus from boxing.  I'm talking to kids in juvenile detention centers, alternative schools, gang units, because I'm talking about anti-bullying.  I share my experiences growing up and how I was treated and how it led to an inner rage in the ring and how I was able to overcome that.  I don't preach to them.  I just share my story and basically a lot of public speaking.  And then I'll be back in the ring in about four months.  Sounds good.
Well, thanks so much for joining us.  Where can we find you?  Facebook, Instagram, Twitter?
I'm on Facebook.  It's at Nino Boxer.  Instagram is NinoBoxer1.  My website is DavidNinoRodriguez.com.
Sounds great.  Well, thanks so much for joining us.  Thank you.  You're watching New York Fashion Times.  Thank you.
